bibl.title: M.C. Quinn v. H.G. Thornton. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District in Washington Territory

body.p: In the District Court holding terms at Seattle for King County Territory of Washington
In matter of the application of M.C. Quinn for Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Hon. Thomas Burke Judge of the above entitled Court
Your petitioner M.C. Quinn comes now and respectfully represents
I
That he makes this application for himself and in his own behalf
II
That he your petitioner is restrained of his liberty in the City of Seattle King County Territory of Washington by H.G. Thornton a constable of Seattle precinct said county,
III
That the cause of your petitioner being restrained of his liberty to the best of his information

and belief is that on the 4th day of February 1889 one James Braid filed before and N. Soderberg a Justice of the Peace for said Seattle Precinct King County W.T. a complaint in words and figures following to wit- "In justices Court Seattle Precinct King County Washington Territory before N. Soderberg Justice of the Peace-
Territory of Washington } Complaint vs M.C. Quinn
Territory of Washington County of King } ss

James Braid being duly sworn on his oath says that at Seattle -- said King County on the 3rd day of February 1889 did commit the crime of threatening to commit injury to the person and property of another, as follows the said M.C. Quinn then and there being did willfully and in a threatening angry and rude manner say that he would hunt down and shoot and
cut down the affiant and would do affiant bodily injury harm contrary to the form of the in such made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the Territory of Washington
James Braid Subscribed and sworn to before me this 4th day of February 1889 N. Soderberg

That immediately thereafter and without examination of other witnesses or other evidence the said Justice of the Peace issued a warrant for the arrest of your petitioner and your petitioner was on this day arrested and brought before said Justice of the Peace for trial above said pretended charge that previous to the commenciment your petitioner in his own behalf of the trial before said Justice of the Peace when said pretended
charge your petitioner in his own behalf made and filed with said Justice of the Peace his affidavit for a change of venue which affidavit was in words and figures following to wit
"In Justice Court before N. Soderberg a justice of the Peace for King County W.T.
The Territory of Washington } Affidavit Plaintiff for change vs of Venue M.C. Quinn Defendant
The Territory of Washington } ss County of King

M.C. Quinn being first duly sworn on his oath says that he is the defendant above named that he believes that he can not have a fair and impartial trial before N. Soderberg the Justice of the Peace before whom the above entitled
action is pending and therefore asks that the place of trial be changed
M.C. Quinn Signed in my presence and sworn to before me this 5th day of February 1889
Y.J. Hermes Notary Public

That said Justice of the Peace Contrary to the advice of the prosecuting attorney of this District and denied said defendants motion for a change of the venue in said case, and therefore proceeded without authority and unlawfully to hear and determine the guilt or innocence of your petitioner upon said charge all of which was over and of the objecting of your petitioner and without his consent, and against the objections of your petitioner unlawfully found your petitioner

guilty of the acts charged to said annexed complaint and unlawfully sentenced your petitioner to pay the costs of said proceeding and required your petitioner to enter into a recognizance to the Territory of Washington in the sum of one hundred dollars for his good behavior for the of ninety days and to pay said costs - which your petitioner has failed to do - Wherefore as your petitioner is informed said justice of the Peace issued a pretended commitment authorizing said H.G. Thornton to confine your petitioner in the jail of said County, until said judgement is complied with
IV
That said restraint is illegal in that said Justice of the Peace had no jurisdiction to hear and determine said cause

Wherefore your petitioner prays that Writ of Habeas Corpus issue herein that the cause of said restraint be engrained with and that he be discharged from custody. and have such order in the premises asks the Court may act just and properly
M.C. Quinn
The Territory of Washington County of King } ss

M.C. Quinn being first duly sworn under his oath says that he is the petitioner above named. that he has heard read the foregoing petition knows the contents and that the same is true as he hereby believes
M.C. Quinn
Signed in my presence and sworn to before me this 8th day of Feb 1889
Y.J. Hermes Notary Public
No. 6542 In matter of application of M.C. Quinn on Writ of Habeas Corpus
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED FEB 5 1889 W.E. Ledgerwood, Clerk.
Henry & Andrews Attys for Petitioner
